Description: During this four-month project, I designed Gelato House Franchise Ltd's ice cream ordering app, giving users a fun four-step flow to create and order their customized ice cream. I conducted landscape analysis and user research to know what features align with users' needs. I worked with Figma, Adobe Illustrator, and Photoshop to build the prototype and final designs.

The website you are browsing is my portfolio, which I developed using HTML and CSS. The initial design was crafted in Figma, and then brought to life through lines of code that I wrote with love. I have tried to create a clean, simple design that effectively showcases my work while incorporating engaging elements.

I learned to code by working on real projects. This was my second website project, where I redesigned the old website for Twilight Clinic. I aimed for a simple, clean, and elegant look. I first created the design in Figma and then built the site using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. I also made an effort to improve my code by using more professional approaches, like custom properties and utility classes.

UX design taught me how to improve every product I use. Working with the Flystein website sparked the idea that what I see has the potential to be better. By using competitor research and reviewing published articles about user trends in the travel industry, I tried to design a better version of Flystein's landing page using Adobe XD.
